page.title: 12Places of Worship
page.content: {Stetchworth}Parish Church is St.Peter's.Parts of it are Early English,so it is at least 700 years old,other parts are Perpendicular and early and late 19th Century.At present it is in need of substantial repair.Stetchworth also has a{United {Reformed Church}which has a Sunday School. {Woodditton}Parish church is called St.Mary's.It used to be made of wood but it has been replaced by flint.The church is built on higher ground about a mile from the centre of the village.It seems that the village has moved away from the church as the forests have been cut and the land cultivated.The church used to have four bells but now has five.The advantage of the extra bell is that 120 changes can be rung against only 24 with four bells.
